greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of divisors of n of form 4k+1.
comment: Not multiplicative: a(21) <> a(3)*a(7), for example. - _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 15 2015
link: Nick Hobson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Michael Gilleland, Some Self-Similar Integer Sequences
maple: d:=proc(r,m,n) local i,t1; t1:=0; for i from 1 to n do if n mod i = 0 and i-r mod m = 0 then t1:=t1+1; fi; od: t1; end; # no. of divisors i of n with i == r mod m
mathematica: a[n_] := Count[Divisors[n], d_ /; Mod[d, 4] == 1]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 105}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 26 2013 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
